title: Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards gear up to confront Simon on X Factor: Celebrity
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards are gearing up to confront Simon Cowell in this year’s X Factor: Celebrity.

The duo will be taking to the stage in tonight’s launch and it seems as though they are brimming with confidence.

In a clip shared exclusively to Metro.co.uk, the contestants told the show to ‘bring it on’.

The Hollyoaks star can be seen saying: ‘The singing has been challenging but we have been enjoying it. I think people might be pleasantly surprised.’

And it seems his duetting buddy, and Strictly Come Dancing pro Brendan is in agreement, as he added: ‘I can speak for both of us when I say bring it on.’

Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards gear up to confront Simon on X Factor: Celebrity (Picture: ITV)

Laughing at their video, the duo joked how the ending seemed to have fallen flat, with them repeating the phrase ‘bring it on’ one last time.

The stars spoke with reporter Katie Begley ahead of their performance, where they confessed they would be gutted to leave before the live shows.

Jeremy stated: ‘Of course I’ll be absolutely gutted if we don’t get to go to the live shows. I really, really hope we do because I would love to go on stage.

‘It would frighten a lot of people, it doesn’t frighten me. The idea of being in front of a big audience, you know, that is just my dream. I love it.’

They’re brimming with confidence (Picture: PA)

While his pal Brendan said: ‘Yeah, I’d love to get through to the live shows. If you have a good production, it enhances what you’re doing.

‘I’ve always been big on production, in terms of my own shows. But bigger doesn’t necessarily mean better.’

He continued: ‘If you’re doing something really beautiful and simple, I want the most elegant and simple lighting effects you can have.

‘Likewise, if we ever get to do something rocky then I want flames, I want fricking broken guitars, I want the full shebang.’

The X Factor: Celebrity continues next Saturday on ITV.
